titleStmt.title: Gnomic Anthology with Lines of Euripides' Danae and Orestes

availability.p: © Digital Corpus of Literary Papyri. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License .

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Finalized - This is good to go. I have accepted unilaterally several of the unobjectionable PN emendations.
Finalized - This is good to go. I have accepted unilaterally several of the unobjectionable PN emendations.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - It is preferable to approve the text of the ed.pr. before entertaining the online emendations. Remove |ed| tags for attested readings as per DCLP policy; add lost.?lin before line 1; I wonder whether ἥττονας in l. 2 should be regularized (I know of no example of ττ > δ, however); fix apostrophes throughout; indent line 6. Review all metadata before finalization.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - It is preferable to approve the text of the ed.pr. before entertaining the online emendations. Remove |ed| tags for attested readings as per DCLP policy; add lost.?lin before line 1; I wonder whether ἥττονας in l. 2 should be regularized (I know of no example of ττ > δ, however); fix apostrophes throughout; indent line 6. Review all metadata before finalization.

Submit - Julia, Thank you for your notes! 1) I've made changes in Meta according to the edditorial notes. 2) I've added "=PN A. Sonina (from photo)" where it is needed. As for the photo, Elena Chepel said, she has sent it via mail. If there are some mistakes, that were left unnoticed, please, let me know.

Submit - Julia, Thank you for your notes! 1) I've made changes in Meta according to the edditorial notes. 2) I've added "=PN A. Sonina (from photo)" where it is needed. As for the photo, Elena Chepel said, she has sent it via mail. If there are some mistakes, that were left unnoticed, please, let me know.

Vote - Return-Straight-to-Sender - Meta: add biblio for CPF (95344), Pordomingo (95250), and Kannicht (73274), and delete volume in the entry for P.Ross.Georg. 1; Legacy display name needs to be entered under Display name, info in Display name deleted; add dimensions; add MP3 number; shorten the description in the Notes (use standard abbreviations e.g. P.Ross.Georg. etc.). Text: l. 1, ed.pr. has δ]εξίαμα; i. 4, Κύπρι]ς̣, I am not sure dotting the sigma as opposed to the undotted of the ed.pr. is needed. For this and the change in l. 7, however, it would be best if the person suggesting the changes shared a photo with one of the editors (this is a common practice). For changes, follow the standard encoding, which is "=PN A. Sonina (from photo)". Does l. 7 of the papyrus have κρῖττον or κρεῖττον (the latter printed in P.Ross.Georg.)? Please resubmit with the above changes.

Vote - Return-Straight-to-Sender - Meta: add biblio for CPF (95344), Pordomingo (95250), and Kannicht (73274), and delete volume in the entry for P.Ross.Georg. 1; Legacy display name needs to be entered under Display name, info in Display name deleted; add dimensions; add MP3 number; shorten the description in the Notes (use standard abbreviations e.g. P.Ross.Georg. etc.). Text: l. 1, ed.pr. has δ]εξίαμα; i. 4, Κύπρι]ς̣, I am not sure dotting the sigma as opposed to the undotted of the ed.pr. is needed. For this and the change in l. 7, however, it would be best if the person suggesting the changes shared a photo with one of the editors (this is a common practice). For changes, follow the standard encoding, which is "=PN A. Sonina (from photo)". Does l. 7 of the papyrus have κρῖττον or κρεῖττον (the latter printed in P.Ross.Georg.)? Please resubmit with the above changes.
Submit - We've made the transcription of the text and apparatus criticus. We've updated the inventory number and added introduction.
Submit - We've made the transcription of the text and apparatus criticus. We've updated the inventory number and added introduction.

div.ab:
ὦ χρυσέ, δεξίαμα κάλλιστον βροτοῖς,
ὡς οὔτε μήτηρ ἡδονὰς ἡττοναςἥττονας τοιάσδ’ ἔχει,
οὐ παῖδες ἀνθρώποισινἐν δόμοισιν, οὐ φίλος πατήρ,
εἰ δ’ ἡ Κύπρις τοιοῦτον ὀφθαλμοῖςὀφθαλμοῖσιν ὁρᾷνὁρᾷ,
οὐ θαῦμ’ Ἔρωτας μυρίους αὐτὴν ἔχειν.
ἄλλο
οὐκ ἔστινἔστιν οὐδὲνοὐθὲν κρεῖττονκρῖττον ἢ φίλοςφίλονφίλος σαφής,
οὐ πλοῦτοςπλοῦτος, οὐ τυραννίς. ἀλόγιστονἀλόγιστιν δέ τιτει

div.p: This digital edition was prepared by Anastasia Sonina from a photograph as part of the research project "From the Nile to the Caucasus: G. Zereteli and his papyrus collection" funded by RFBR and FWF (N 20-59-14002). It is mostly based on the previous edition (P.Ross.Georg. I 9).
